title: Lansing man to stand trial in shooting of 2-year-old
content:
LANSING – A Lansing man will stand trial in what police believe to be the accidental shooting of a 2-year-old girl.
Jaylen Briggs, 20, of Lansing, waived his preliminary hearing today in 54A District Court. The hearing was to determine if there was enough evidence for him to stand trial.
The case now moves to Ingham County Circuit Court.
The girl was shot around 8:45 p.m. on April 17, in the 5600 block of S. Martin Luther King Boulevard. Briggs, who is known to the family, fled the scene, according to police. The shooting is believed to be accidental, police said. She was initially listed in critical condition but was later upgraded to stable, police said.
Briggs is charged with careless discharge of a weapon causing injury or death and other firearm charges.
